duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format.

@graph.rdfs:comment: A categorization of a temporal relationship to a dataset, NOT the dataset record. Eg- data collection temporal interval, screening temporal interval, etc.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Datasets contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

doi.description: Digital object identifier (DOI) for the Dataset

@graph.rdfs:comment: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the Dataset. Note: the DOI should be a permanent identifier for the Dataset itself, not any publications associated with the Dataset.
@graph.rdfs:label: doi

The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalTool

@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

species.description: Species(es) from which dataset has been collected or for which the tool was designed or applied.

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

distribution.description: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

items.description: A dataset in downloadable form.

includedInDataCatalog.description: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

measurementTechnique.description:
A technique or technology used in a [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]),
corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using [[variableMeasured]]). This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but rather as a high level summary for dataset discovery.

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence".

If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory".

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]].

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

variableMeasured.description: The variableMeasured property can indicate (repeated as necessary) the  variables that are measured in some dataset, either described as text or as pairs of identifier and description using PropertyValue.

abstract.description: An abstract is a short description that summarizes a [[CreativeWork]].

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

author.description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, an item. Typically used for real world items such as an [[ArchiveComponent]] held by an [[ArchiveOrganization]]. This property is not suitable for use as a general Web access control mechanism. It is expressed only in natural language.\n\nFor example "Available by appointment from the Reading Room" or "Accessible only from logged-in accounts ".

creator.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

hasPart.description: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

inLanguage.description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

isBasedOn.description: A resource from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption.

isPartOf.description: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

sdPublisher.description:
Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The
[[sdPublisher]] property helps make such practices more explicit.

spatialCoverage.description:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

identifier.description: An identifier for the location, preferably a Wikidata ID.

locationType.description: Categorization of how the location relates to the dataset or computational tool

items.description: Location information

identifier.description: An identifier for the location, preferably a Wikidata ID.

locationType.description: Categorization of how the location relates to the dataset or computational tool

temporalCoverage.description:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format.

temporalType.description: Categorization of how the date/temporal interval relates to the dataset or computational tool

items.description: Temporal information

duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format.

temporalType.description: Categorization of how the date/temporal interval relates to the dataset or computational tool

usageInfo.description:
The schema.org [[usageInfo]] property indicates further information about a [[CreativeWork]]. This property is applicable both to works that are freely available and to those that require payment or other transactions. It can reference additional information e.g. community expectations on preferred linking and citation conventions, as well as purchasing details. For something that can be commercially licensed, usageInfo can provide detailed, resource-specific information about licensing options.

This property can be used alongside the license property which indicates license(s) applicable to some piece of content. The usageInfo property can provide information about other licensing options, e.g. acquiring commercial usage rights for an image that is also available under non-commercial creative commons licenses.

version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

citation.description: A citation object for a resource which is cited by the dataset (ie- is a derivative of the dataset) , related to the dataset, or from which the dataset was based on (ie- is derived from).

datePublished.description: Date the referenced resource was published

name.description: Name or title of the citation

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the citation

pmid.description: A PubMed identifier of the referenced publication, if available

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced resource, if available

issueNumber.description: Issue number where the referenced resource appears

journalName.description: Journal where the referenced resource appears

journalNameAbbrev.description: Abbreviated journal name where the referenced resource appears

pagination.description: Page numbers in the journal where the referenced resource appears

url.description: The url of the resource cited

volumeNumber.description: Volume of the journal where the referenced resource appears

citation.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced resource as is provided

datePublished.description: Date the referenced resource was published

includedInDataCatalog.description: Data or tool catalog which houses the work

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the citation

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced resource, if available

url.description: The url of the resource cited

citation.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced resource as is provided

curatedBy.description: The person, organization, or catalog that categorized the work

softwareRequirements.description: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

author.description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a minimal ComputationalTool for the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease (NIAID). A ComputationalTool is a software used for the collection, processing, distribution, analysis, visualization, interpretation, etc. of data. Additional schema.org and/or custom properties could be added.
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalTool

name.description: Descriptive name of the computational tool

description.description: Longer description of what is contained in the computational tool

identifier.description: Identifiers for the computational tool (ideally less than 15 characters)

creator.description: Name of the author or organization that created the computational tool.  Note: schema.org/creator and schema.org/organization have additional fields that can provide more information about the author/organization, if desired.

sdPublisher.description: Original publisher of the ComputationalTool metadata (like GitHub). Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The sdPublisher property helps make such practices more explicit.

dateModified.description: date when the computational tool has been modified

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

citation.description: Journal article or other publication associated with the computational tool (stored as an object, not a string)

applicationCategory.description: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'. Please use terms from the 'Tool type' table in the biotools documentation.

applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'. Use an EDAM:Topic to describe the category of application

codeRepository.description: Link to the source code repository of the tool.

programmingLanguage.description: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool. Please use terms from the ‘Programming language’ table in the Bio.Tools documentation

softwareVersion.description: Version(s) of the tool, which this information is valid for. Can also be a comma-delimited list and include hyphen-separated ranges of versions.

featureList.description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications). Functionality provided by the tool. This is similar to measurementTechnique in Dataset.

species.description: Species(es) from which the computation tool is based

infectiousAgent.description: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the computational tool (e.g. SARS-CoV-2)

healthCondition.description: The infectious disease(s) or health condition(s) which are the focus of the computational tool (e.g. COVID-19, pneumonia, etc.)

funding.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this computational tool through some kind of financial contribution

article.description: A scholarly article in which the computational tool is cited.

pathogenControlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

speciesControlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

diseaseControlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

monetaryGrant.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this computational tool through some kind of financial contribution

funder.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a computational tool

description.description: description about the funding award / grant

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant(s) used to fund the Dataset

name.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a computational tool

parentOrganization.description: name of the parent funding organization

@graph.rdfs:comment: Link to the source code repository of the tool.
@graph.rdfs:label: codeRepository

@graph.rdfs:comment: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool. Please use terms from the ‘Programming language’ table in the Bio.Tools documentation
@graph.rdfs:label: programmingLanguage

@graph.rdfs:comment: An organization that supports (sponsors) the development or maintenance of this computational tool through some kind of financial contribution.
@graph.rdfs:label: funder

@graph.rdfs:comment: Datasets contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

citedBy.description: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the dataset

date.description: Date the dataset has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the dataset, not any associated publications

isRelatedTo.description: Datasets which are related to the given dataset; often datasets involved in the same study. These linkages are created via human curation.

isSimilarTo.description: Datasets which are similar to the dataset, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.

isBasisFor.description: A dataset which reuses the dataset

nctid.description: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier associated with the Dataset

relationship.description: How an associated work is related to the Dataset

topicCategory.description: Topic of the Dataset. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.

infectiousAgent.description: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the dataset (like SARS-CoV-2)

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

healthCondition.description: The health condition(s) /infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the dataset (like COVID-19, coronavirus)

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

funding.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

items.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

description.description: description of the funding award / grant

funder.description: An organization or person who funded the creation of the dataset

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant or contract used to fund the dataset

species.description: Species / host organism from which dataset has been collected

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

distribution.description: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

items.description: A dataset in downloadable form.

includedInDataCatalog.description: A data catalog where the dataset is published; original source of the metadata

measurementTechnique.description: A technique or technology used in a  dataset corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using variableMeasured). For example, if variableMeasured is molecule concentration, measurementTechnique could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence".
measurementTechnique.abstract: measurement technique used to collect the dataset

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

abstract.description: Short description that summarizes a dataset

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the dataset. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.

author.description: Author or creator of the dataset

citation.description: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the dataset. Examples: a publication which describes the collection/analysis of the dataset, a publication which reuses the dataset in a secondary analysis, a dataset which extends the existing dataset, or a computational tool which relies on the dataset.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the dataset. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished)

creator.description: The creator/author of this dataset; equivalent to author

datePublished.description: Date the dataset was first published

hasPart.description: Associated materials for the dataset, including data dictionaries and data limitation descriptions

inLanguage.description: The language of the content of the dataset

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions with the dataset, such as page views or tool downloads

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the dataset is accessible for free.

isBasedOn.description: A dataset, publication, or computational tool from which this dataset is derived, modified, or adapted
isBasedOn.abstract: dataset, publication, or tool used to create the dataset

isPartOf.description: Indicates a broader study, project, or collection the dataset is part of
isPartOf.abstract: study or project including the dataset

keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this dataset

license.description: A license document that applies to this dataset, typically indicated by URL.

sdPublisher.description: Original publisher of the dataset metadata (like GenBank, ImmPort, etc.)

spatialCoverage.description: The place(s) which are the focus of the dataset

items.description: Location information

administrativeType.description: the type of administrative area, such as country, state, county, or city

identifier.description: An identifier for the location, preferably a Wikidata ID

locationType.description: Categorization of how the location relates to the dataset

temporalCoverage.description: The period of time covered within the dataset

items.description: Temporal information

duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format

temporalType.description: Categorization of how the date/temporal interval relates to the dataset

usageInfo.description: Data usage agreement, specifying the terms under which the dataset can be used. Note that this is related to but distinct from the license.

alternateName.description: An alias for the dataset name

identifier.description: Dataset identifier or accesssion number, such as a digital object identifier (DOI), sequence read archive (SRA) or GenBank accession number, etc.

mainEntityOfPage.description: Website which describes the dataset and provides additional details

sameAs.description: URL of additional sources for the dataset

citation.description: A citation object for a resource which is cited by the dataset (ie- is a derivative of the dataset) , related to the dataset, or from which the dataset was based on (ie- is derived from).

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the citation such as a digital object identifier (DOI), PubMed ID (PMID), or PubMed Central ID (PMCID)

pmid.description: A PubMed identifier (PMID) of the referenced publication

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced publication

issueNumber.description: Issue number where the article appears

journalNameAbbrev.description: Abbreviated journal name where the article appears

pagination.description: Page numbers in the journal where the article appears

volumeNumber.description: Volume of the journal where the article appears

citation.description: The bibliographic citation string for the article as is provided

datePublished.description: Date the referenced work was published

includedInDataCatalog.description: Data or tool catalog which houses the work

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the work

doi.description: A digital object identifier (DOI) of the referenced work

citation.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced work as is provided

curatedBy.description: The person, organization, or catalog that categorized the dataset

url.description: Link to data or tool catalog

versionDate.description: date the metadata was harvested from the catalog

name.description: Name of the affiliation, such as a university

parentOrganization.description: Name of the parent organization. For instance, the parentOrganization of NIAID is the National Institutes of health (NIH)

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the organization

role.description: What role the organization played in creating the dataset

name.description: Name of the affiliation, such as a university

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the person, like an ORCID ID

role.description: Role the person played in creating the dataset

url.description: Link to the homepage or other web content describing the person

@graph.rdfs:comment: ComputationalTools (software, workflows, computational tools, code) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalTool

citedBy.description: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the computational tool

date.description: Date the computational tool has changed: most recent date of dateModified, datePublished, and dateCreated.

doi.description: Digital object identifier (DOI) for the computational tool, not any associated publications

includedInDataCatalog.description: Data or tool catalog where the computational tool is published; original source of the metadata

isBasisFor.description: A computational tool which reuses the computational tool

isRelatedTo.description: Computational tools which are related to the given computational tool. These linkages are created via human curation.

isSimilarTo.description: Computational tools which are similar to the computational tool, based on terms in the names, descriptions, authors, measurementTechniques, infectiousAgents, healthConditions, etc.

topicCategory.description: Topic of the ComputationalTool. This topic may be assigned by a human curator or through automated algorithms.

infectiousAgent.description: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the computational tool (like SARS-CoV-2)

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

healthCondition.description: The health condition(s) / infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the computational tool (e.g. COVID-19, coronavirus)

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

funding.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the development of this computational tool through some kind of financial contribution

items.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the development of this computational tool through some kind of financial contribution

description.description: description of the funding award / grant

funder.description: An organization or person who funded the creation of the computational tool

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant or contract used to fund the computational tool

species.description: Species / host organism from which the tool was designed or applied

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

codeRepository.description: Link to the source code repository of the tool such as GitHub

programmingLanguage.description: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool

input.description: software input, such as a file or parameter

applicationCategory.description: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

applicationSuite.description: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

downloadUrl.description: URL to download the computational tool

featureList.description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

processorRequirements.description: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

softwareAddOn.description: Additional content for a software application

softwareHelp.description: URL to access software application help

softwareRequirements.description: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the computational tool. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.

author.description: Author or creator of the computational tool

citation.description: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the computational tool. Examples: a publication which describes the development of the computational tool, a publication which describes the extension or use of the computational tool, a datset which was processed or analyzed using the tool, or a computational tool which relies on the given tool.

conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the computational tool. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished)

contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the developement or maintenance of the computational tool

creator.description: The creator/author of this computational tool; equivalent to author

dateCreated.description: Date the computational tool was created

dateModified.description: Date the computational tool was modified

datePublished.description: Date the computational tool was first published

discussionUrl.description: A link to a webpage containing the comments about the computational tool.

hasPart.description: An item that is part of this computational tool

inLanguage.description: The language of the computational tool (not programming language)

interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions with the computational tool, such as page views or tool downloads

isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the computational tool is accessible for free.

@graph.rdfs:comment: A schema describing a minimal Dataset for the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease (NIAID). A dataset is a collection of data of a particular experimental type. Additional schema.org and/or custom properties could be added.
@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

description.description: Longer description of what is contained in the dataset

measurementTechnique.description: A technique or technology used in a Dataset, corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s).

identifier.description: Identifiers for the dataset (ideally less than 15 characters)

creator.description: Name of the author or organization that created the dataset.  Note: schema.org/creator and schema.org/organization have additional fields that can provide more information about the author/organization, if desired.

sdPublisher.description: Original publisher of the Dataset metadata (like GenBank, ImmPort, etc.). Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The sdPublisher property helps make such practices more explicit.

distribution.description: DataDownload objects, which contain the URL link to download the raw, analyzed, and summary data associated with the dataset as well as associated metadata for the file.

citation.description: Journal article or other publication associated with the dataset (stored as an object, not a string)

funding.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

species.description: Species(es) from which dataset has been collected

infectiousAgent.description: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the dataset (e.g. SARS-CoV-2)

healthCondition.description: The Infectious disease(s) / health condition(s) which are the focus of the dataset (e.g. COVID-19, pneumonia, etc.)

spatialCoverage.description: spatial information related to the dataset

temporalCoverage.description: temporal information related to the dataset. For dates pertaining to the dataset record, use datePublished, dateCreated, dateModified, etc.

controlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

pathogenControlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

speciesControlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

diseaseControlledVocabulary.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

monetaryGrant.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution

funder.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

description.description: description about the funding award / grant

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant(s) used to fund the Dataset

name.description: An organization associated with a creator or funder of a dataset

parentOrganization.description: name of the parent funding organization

article.description: A scholarly article in which the dataset is cited.

locationType.description: Categorization of how the location relates to the dataset or computational tool

identifier.description: An identifier for the location, preferably a Wikidata ID.

temporalType.description: Categorization of how the date/temporal interval relates to the dataset or computational tool

duration.description: A time interval in ISO 8601 duration format.
